judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA
AT CHANDIGARH
CWP No. 11761 of 1989
 Date of decision: 12.9.2011
M/s Kailash Cotton Ginning Factory
 ..Petitioner
vs.
Assessing Authority, Bathinda
 ..Respondent
CORAM: - HON BLE MR. JUSTICE HEMANT GUPTA
HON BLE MR. JUSTICE JASWANT SINGH
Present: - None for the petitioner
Mr. A.P.S. Maan, Addl. AG. Punjab for respondent
HEMANT GUPTA, J 
The petitioner is a dealer under the Punjab General
Sales Tax Act, 1948 and also under Central Sales Tax Act,
. The petitioner sold cotton seed oil which is claimed by the
petitioner as edible oil fit for human consumption and on which
sales tax @ 1% is leviable in terms of notification dated
.1.1979. Such claim of the petitioner was not accepted by the
Assessing Authority, Bathinda in its order dated 25.1.1990. It
was found that the Central Sales Tax on inter state sales of
cotton seed oil other than edible oil fit for human consumption
is 4% against  C  forms whereas the petitioner has deposited
only 1%. The assessment was framed accordingly.
The issue raised in the present petition was also
raised in CWP No. 6919 of 1987. The said writ petition was
allowed on 18.7.1991 by the learned Single Bench of this Court.
But Letter Patent Appeal against the said judgment was
accepted by the Division Bench of this Court vide the judgment
CWP No. 11761 of 1989
reported as (1998) 118 PLR 103 State of Punjab and ors vs.
Milkhi Ram Oil and Dall Mills decided on 21.8.1997. It has been
held that the cotton seed oil is not edible oil in the hands of
dealer. Thus, the issue whether the cotton seed oil is not edible
oil stands concluded in the case of Milkhi Ram Oil (supra).
In view of the said decision, present petition is
dismissed for the reasons recorded in the case of Milkhi Ram Oil
(supra).
(HEMANT GUPTA)
JUDGE
.9.2011 (JASWANT SINGH)
preeti
 JUDGE
